intro: Stegnogramma xinwenensis, commonly known as the Xinwen starwort, is a rare aquatic plant native to China. It belongs to the family Hydrocharitaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, star-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and ditches. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually appearing in clusters, and it plays a role in maintaining aquatic ecosystems. Due to habitat loss and pollution, it is considered a threatened species.
